meanings.sent1: The strictions placed on the project deadline made it challenging to complete on time.
meanings.sent2: The strictions on the number of guests allowed at the event were clearly communicated.
meanings.sent3: The strictions on eating dessert before dinner were broken by the mischievous child.
meanings.sent4: The strictions on creativity felt like a heavy weight on the artist's shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The strictions on noise levels in the library were enforced by the librarian.

meanings.definition: The act of restricting or confining
meanings.sent1: The strictions of the prison walls kept the inmates from escaping.
meanings.sent2: The strictions of the traffic regulations helped maintain order on the roads.
meanings.sent3: The strictions of the maze made it a fun challenge for the participants.
meanings.sent4: The strictions of tradition held strong in the small village.
meanings.sent5: The strictions of the contract limited the company's options for expansion.

meanings.definition: A narrowing or tightening of something
meanings.sent1: The strictions of the belt caused discomfort after a large meal.
meanings.sent2: The strictions of the rope around the box kept it securely closed.
meanings.sent3: The strictions of the jar lid made it difficult to open.
meanings.sent4: The strictions of the bandage helped stop the bleeding.
meanings.sent5: The strictions of the knot were too tight to untangle easily.
